title: Example script
code: # Clear environment rm(list = ls())  # Load relevant libraries library(modelLong) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  # Load example longitudinal data (must be of long format) data <- read.csv("../data/ortho.csv")[-1] data_labelled <- data  # Rename variables data_labelled <- data %>% dplyr::rename("Distance" = distance, "Age" = age)  # Preview data data_labelled[sample(nrow(data_labelled), 5),] ##     Subject    Sex Distance Age ## 151     M16   Male     26.1  18 ## 63      M09   Male     31.0  12 ## 102     F05 Female     23.5  14 ## 111     M03   Male     27.9  16 ## 47      F04 Female     24.5  10

title: Example script
code: # Data summary, stratified by Sex summary_res <- modelLong::summary(     data = data_labelled[-1], # Ignore Subject ID     group_var = "Sex",     type = list(Age ~ "continuous"))  summary_res$table1

title: Example script
text: Plot repeated measures adolescent tooth growth time.
code: # Create plot of repeated measures plot_res <- modelLong::plot(   data = data,    outcome = "distance",    time = "age",    id = "Subject",   group_var = "Sex")  plot_res$data_plot +   # Adjust labels and x-axis   labs(title = "Repeated measures of tooth growth") +   xlab("Age (years)") + ylab("Distance (mm)") +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(8,18,2)) plot_res$acf_plot +   # Adjust labels and x-axis   labs(title = "Autocorrelation of tooth growth") + xlab("Age (years)")

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Hernandez AD (2025). modelLong: Model visualize longitudinal data. R package version 1.0, https://alejandroh3005.github.io/modelLong/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {modelLong: Model and visualize longitudinal data},   author = {Alejandro Dionicio Hernandez},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {https://alejandroh3005.github.io/modelLong/}, }

title: Model and visualize longitudinal data
text: package easy visualization modeling longitudinal data. Functions plot repeated measures estimate autocorrelation, marginal effects generalized estimating equations, conditional effects generalized linear mixed-effects models. URL GitHub (.e., source code) : https://github.com/alejandroh3005/modelLong URL Pkgdown webpage : https://alejandroh3005.github.io/

title: Model and visualize longitudinal data
text: package called modelLong. install, run following code (R): Upon completion, can run following code (R):

title: Model and visualize longitudinal data
text: package depends following packages: dplyr, ggplot2, gtsummary, lme4, geepack.

title: Model and visualize longitudinal data
text: Thank Dr. Kevin Lin kind instruction encouragement.

what: Estimate marginal effects with generalized estimating equations — fit_gee
title: Estimate marginal effects with generalized estimating equations — fit_gee
text: Estimate marginal effects generalized estimating equations. Data must long format.

title: Estimate marginal effects with generalized estimating equations — fit_gee

title: Estimate conditional effects with generalized linear mixed-effects models — fit_glmm

what: Plot repeated measures and autocorrelation — plot
title: Plot repeated measures and autocorrelation — plot
text: Plot repeated measures averages time, autocorrelation measures calculated acf(). Returned ggplot objects may manipulated (multiple facets, additional layers, etc.). Data must long format.

title: Plot repeated measures and autocorrelation — plot
Plot repeated measures and autocorrelation — plot
code: library(ggplot2)  # Load repeated measures of adolescent tooth growth (must be of long format) data <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alejandroh3005/modelLong/main/data/ortho.csv")[-1]  # Plot the repeated measures and autocorrelation plot_res <- modelLong::plot(   data = data,   outcome = "distance",   time = "age",   id = "Subject",   group_var = "Sex") #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  # View repeated measures plot plot_res$data_plot +   # Adjust labels and x-axis   labs(title = "Repeated measures of tooth growth") +   xlab("Age (years)") + ylab("Distance (mm)") +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(8,18,2))   # View autocorrelation plot plot_res$acf_plot +   # Adjust labels   labs(title = "Autocorrelation of tooth growth") + xlab("Age (years)")

what: Summarize data in a table — summary
title: Summarize data in a table — summary
text: Generate Table 1 style summary data, optional variable stratify descriptions (overall summary statistics always included). Data must long format.

title: Summarize data in a table — summary
Summarize data in a table — summary
code: # Load repeated measures of adolescent tooth growth (must be of long format) data <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alejandroh3005/modelLong/main/data/ortho.csv")[-1] colnames(data)[3:4] <- c("Distance", "Age")  # Summarize data, stratify by sex, and ensure age is encoded as continuous summary_res <- modelLong::summary(   data = data[-1],  # Ignore Subject ID   group_var = "Sex",   type = list(Age ~ "continuous"))  # View summary table summary_res$table1     Variable       Overall N = 1621                Sex            Female N = 661       Male N = 961     Distance 24.72 (22.50, 26.50) 23.09 (21.50, 24.60) 25.83 (23.50, 27.50)Age 13 (10, 16) 13 (10, 16) 13 (10, 16)1 Mean (Q1, Q3)
